intro: Zosterophyllanthos tamaensis, commonly known as the Tama zosterophyllum, is a rare and ancient plant species with unique botanical features. It belongs to the order Zosterophyllales, which includes some of the earliest known land plants. This plant exhibits a simple, branching structure with small, ribbon-like leaves that are characteristic of its evolutionary lineage. Its reproductive structures are primitive, suggesting a close relationship to early vascular plants. Despite its historical significance, it is currently found only in a few isolated habitats in Tama, highlighting its conservation status.
